fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Open UkrZaliznytsia app 
2. Choose "Купить билет"
3. Input "Львов" to the field "Откуда" and "Киев" to the field "Куда"
4. Choose date 30/05
5. Press "Поиск поездов" button
6. Choose "Ивано-Франковск - Киев-Пассажирский"
7. Choose "Купе"
8. Choose seat 24
9. Press "Оформить" button
10. Input "Мария" to the field "Имя", "Савенко" to the field "Фамилия"
11. Choose ticket's type "Детский"
12. Input date 22.02.1994
13. Press "Оформить "button

Expected result: app didn't allow to choose incorrect date or gives error message "Неверная дата рождения"
Actual result: "Нет связи с сервером. Повторите попытку позже"
fields.summary: In UkrZaliznytsia app incorrect input of the child's birth date gives "no connection to the server" instead of an input error

Фактический результат: Отсутствие реакции на нажатие.
fields.summary: Укрзалізниця. Отсутствует реакция на нажатие на раздел E-mail в контактах  в разделе дополнительно.

fields.description:
The tab name of a repository when I start Sourcetree is the name of the root directory (the directory that contains the .git directory).

I have several repositories that have the same directory name.

In order to ease the use of Sourcetree, I have renamed each entry of the bookmark list. The tabs have now a specific name different from the corresponding directory name.

But, when I restart Sourcetree, all the automatically opened tabs are named with the corresponding directory. The bookmarks are corrected and if I rename one, the tab is renamed as well.
fields.summary: Tab name is different from the reposirory name

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When you have set a different language than English in your Personal Settings and use the wallboard slideshow, the gadgets will be displayed in English.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Change your language in the Personal Settings to a language that is not English, Deutsch, for example
 # Add a gadget to the dashboard
 # Set to visualize in the Wallboard slideshow

h3. Expected Results

It shows the gadget in the configured language of the profile.
h3. Actual Results

It displays in English - it's intermittent.
h3. Workaround

There isn't a workaround.
fields.summary: Wallboard Slideshow is not Respecting the Language

fields.description:
My desktop shortcut target is :C:\Users\MYUSERNAME\AppData\Local\SourceTree\Update.exe --processStart "SourceTree.exe"

In fact, these 2 exe files doesn't start SourceTree. To be able to start it, I need to throw back again the SourceTreeSetup-2.0.20.1.exe installation file downloaded from the website.

Inside the SourceTree it keeps asking me if I would like ton install the 2.1.2.4 version. So it seems to download it, and it asking me to restart. ... so come the main problem I can't restart from the shortcut. So I restart with the installation file and no update has been done.
fields.summary: Can't start SourceTree from the desktop icon

fields.description:
It's very annoying that I cannot drag a maximized source tree window from the top to restore it the way I do with every other window. I haven't seen this bug since apps were first being made for Windows Vista when Aero Snap was first introduced. Older versions of MS Office had this problem.

 

Also, the split panels cannot always be resized. For example, the horizontal split between the tree view and staging area is locked with the tree taking up around 70% of the view. When I try to drag to resize it, it just snaps back to where it was and seems to maintain the ratio no matter how the window is resized. It makes it impossible to work with files and diffs efficiently.
fields.summary: Aero Snap doesn't work to drag window when maximized; split panels cannot be resized

fields.description:
TL;DR: If the user.config file gets corrupted, SourceTree 1.9.6.1 will not start.

 

I tried to put details in my question https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/44095261

 

Copy/pate:

 

My PC (running Win 10 with latest updates) shut down hard from a sudden power off (human error).

I click on the SourceTree icon and it does ... nothing. No message. Just no start. I click on the icon, get the busy symbol for a moment, and nothing.

I did a complete uninstall and install with the latest SourceTree 1.9.6.1 with no change in behavior.

 

I was eventually able to solve the problem with the following (again, copy/paste):

 

I found that the file

 

\Users\<username>AppData\Local\Atlassian\SourceTree.exe_Url_<randomstring>\1.9.6.1\user.config
was corrupted. Instead of being full of XML, most of the file was full of zeroes (0x00).

 

I copied the user.config file from the 1.9.6.0 sibling directory. I've lost some settings but SourceTree is working again.
fields.summary: Corrupted user config file prevent SourceTree from starting

fields.summary: Sourcetree Enterprise show deleted feature branches from Bitbucket Server

fields.summary: Remove file option includes  unselected files

fields.description:
As requested in answer to my stackoverflow (http://stackoverflow.com/questions/24637748/cant-push-subtree-using-sourcetree) post I'm posting this potential bug here.

Using a basic schema for git subtree I created 2 repository on Github: "project" and "framework" and made the followings:

Clone "project" repository
Add Subtree "framework" in a folder named "framework_dir"
Navigate through "project/framework_dir" and create test.txt
In the "project" working copy add test.txt to and commit it.
Pushing "project" gives the right result on the project repo. I then try to push this change to "framework" but it loops endlessly without giving any errors.

Same manipulation seems to work on the mac app on Mac OSX

Thanks.
fields.summary: Can't push subtree

fields.description:
Summary: File typechange (can be viewed in Git commandline) is not recognized as a pending change by SourceTree. It is just ignored and appears as if nothing had been changed. See screenshots.

This is a major issue for our repository using symlinks. Several other Source Control tools do recognize the typechange.

Ideally there would be a configuration option so we could enable typechange recognition for pending changes.

Note: There is a similar ticket in Sourcetree for Mac (SRCTREE-2167).

 

*Test to demonstrate.*
 * Start with test repo containing two identical files – Textfile.txt and Duplicate.txt.
 * Convert Duplicate.txt to be a symlink pointing to Textfile.txt
 ** !image-2019-05-23-14-26-58-737.png!
 * Sourcetree shows no changes!
 ** !image-2019-05-23-14-27-33-828.png!
 * Git status shows:
 ** !image-2019-05-23-14-27-49-068.png!
 * Gitk shows:
 ** !image-2019-05-23-14-27-58-930.png!
 * VS shows:
 ** !image-2019-05-23-14-28-15-083.png!
fields.summary: File Typechange not recognized as a pending change in Sourcetree
Why is Commit not working?

fields.description:
I'm not focused on Sourcetree, yet process explorer tell me that sourcetree's child git processes are eating nearly 100% of the cpu on all cores (An i7 6700K is 4-core with hyperthreading, so 8 logical cores). I do have an image of this, but i cant figure out how to add to the ticket.

 

I have 6 repo tabs, and 2 submodule repo tabs open (both submodules are the same repo attached to different parent repos), one of the main repos is very binary-file-heavy with images and music, and most of the main repos have 30+ branches.

It seems very similair to this issue from the Mac version as when i collapse the branch lists it seems to let up. https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREE-1064
fields.summary: Near 100% CPU usage while in background

ERROR [2019-04-10 11:21:20,371] [1] [Sourcetree.Installer.Squirrel.Utils.UpdateHelper] [Log] - Couldn't read staging user ID
ERROR [2019-04-10 11:21:20,376] [1] [Sourcetree.Installer.Squirrel.Utils.UpdateHelper] [Log] - Couldn't read staging user ID
ERROR [2019-04-10 11:21:24,662] [1] [Sourcetree.Installer.Squirrel.Utils.UpdateHelper] [Log] - Unable to check for Updates.
System.Net.WebException: The remote server returned an error: (407) Proxy authentication required

— End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown —

at Squirrel.UpdateManager.<CheckForUpdate>d__7.MoveNext()
— End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown —
at System.Runtime.ExceptionServices.ExceptionDispatchInfo.Throw()
at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)
at Sourcetree.Installer.Squirrel.Utils.UpdateHelper.<CheckForUpdate>d__16.MoveNext()
— End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown —

fields.description:
SourceTree 2.0.13-beta-1 silently crashes on launch when there are invalid dictionary files; following stack trace has been produced:
{code:java}
ERROR [2017-03-20 10:41:20,630] [1] [SourceTree.App] [OnStartup] - Failed to start
System.ArgumentException: Cannot set Owner property to itself.
 at System.Windows.Window.set_Owner(Window value)
 at SourceTree.Notifications.NotificationsManager.ShowNotificationDialog[T](NotificationDialogWindow notificationWindow, Tuple`2 customAction, VistaTaskDialogIcon icon)
 at SourceTree.Notifications.NotificationsManager.ShowNotificationDialog[T](String title, String message, Tuple`2 customAction, String cancelLabel, String suppressionSetting, Action`1 suppressionChangedAction, Object contentControl, String contentCommandLabel, Action contentAction)
 at SourceTree.Notifications.NotificationsManager.ShowNotificationDialogWithYesConfirmation(String title, String message, String details)
 at SourceTree.Configuration.WpfSpellCheckerPreFlightCheck.Run()
 at SourceTree.AppRoot.RunPreFlightChecks()
 at SourceTree.AppRoot.OnStartup(StartupEventArgs e)
 at SourceTree.App.OnStartup(StartupEventArgs e)
DEBUG [2017-03-20 10:41:20,633] [3] [SourceTree.Instances.SingleInstance] [PipeConnectionReceived] - SingleInstance pipe connection received
DEBUG [2017-03-20 10:41:20,637] [3] [SourceTree.Instances.SingleInstance] [StartServer] - SingleInstance waiting for connection: iar is not null\{code}

Opening an earlier version of SourceTree (eg. 1.9.10 or even Beta 12) will pop up the Invalid Dictionaries-dialog, after confirming the popup, ST 2.0.13 boots as usual.
fields.summary: Sourcetree fails to launch on invalid dictionaries

fields.description:
I use SourceTree with remote Windows network shares that come and go with regular use. Every time nearly any interaction is done on the UI, SourceTree decides to go lookup some data from the network shares. This, in my use case, always has a 30-90 second timeout that prevents any UI updates. Windows even thinks the program has crashed usually and I must select "Wait for application to finish". Once accessing the file actually times out, the UI usually becomes responsive again for a little bit until it decides to go and check missing network shares again.

This makes me think the thread that does the UI drawing also does the filesystem interaction which means if the filesystem is slow, the UI is slow.

I believe is is the inaccessible network shares that are causing this issue because I can see large pauses in Sourcetree's activity in Sysinternals' Procmon. I have felt the "slowness" that many many other users have reported before I started using network shares. This is different. The UI unresponsiveness for 30+ seconds only started after using network shares.
fields.summary: UI Locks up when SourceTree updates repositories

fields.description:
I have discussed it here

https://community.atlassian.com/t5/SourceTree-discussions/Visual-Studio-Code-conflict/m-p/586917#M88

This flickering and reordering makes it impossible to commit.

I have disabled file watching, as instructed, but then I will not see any changes unless I click fetch.

This issue was never present in before 2.0+
fields.summary: Fix file monitoring on windows

fields.summary: SourceTree keeps automatically folding my folders at seemingly random times

fields.description: For tracked/modified/unstaged files a counter is no longer appearing in File Status, but is now showing the counter in the Commit button. But, there is nothing to commit since the files are unstaged.
fields.summary: Commit button counter changing for modified/unstaged files

fields.description:
When performing a complex rebase deep into a tree, the operation will occasionally fail due to "index.lock" being present, with a message about another git process in operation. If the abort-rebase also fails, the repository can be left in an inconsistent state with possible data loss.

I suspect there is a background process in Sourcetree that is using a git command that monitors for changes/etc that remains active during the rebase process, and there is a race condition where sometimes it manages to grab the lock and causes the rebase to fail. The fix is probably to suspend this process during the rebase and resume afterwards.

To reproduce, select a commit ~15 commits behind the current branch, and select "rebase children of DEADBEEF interactively". Then squash some of the commits at the bottom, or edit some messages, etc to cause everything above it to be rebased onto the changed commit.

It does not occur every time, but farther back is more likely to cause it to reproduce, so try going farther back if you can't get it to reproduce.

Strangely, the bug does not seem to occur when running a command-line interactive rebase, even if SourceTree is still open (tested once or twice but not thoroughly confirmed)
fields.summary: Interactive-rebases fail due to index.lock w/ possible data loss

fields.description:
Hi Support,

2.6.9.0 Enterprise edition prompts for upgrading git-lfs with an yellow flag in the title bar.

A part from that it is completely not acceptable in enterprise for users to use/download/install tools that are not verified by the company and rolled out to the by infrastructure teams, it is prompting the user even if there is "Don't prompt about the new Sourcetree installation." setlled in the options.

(One would think, that this option "don't prompt..." will disappear from the enterprise version, as it is usually prohibited to corporate employees to install software by them selves. One would also think that such option (being disappeared and unchangeable default)will also affect prompts for git-lfs, git and other vcs tools.)

Please fix it.

Best Regards,
fields.summary: 2.6.9.1 Enterprise Edition prompts for upgrades of git-lfs

*Шаги воспроизведения.*

 *1. Открыть [http://nibulon.com/data/zakupivlya-silgospprodukcii/kalkulyator-znizhok.html].*

 *2. В поле "Виберіть культуру" выбрать "Ячмінь"*

 *3. В поле "Виберіть базис поставки:" выбрать "Філія "Сватівська" (Луганська обл.)".*

 *4. В поле "Виберіть показник вологості, %" внести число 50.*

 *5. В поле "Виберіть показник сміттєвої домішки, %" внести число 30.*

 

*Ожидаемый результат: Знижка по вологості - 41,86**%.*

 

*Фактический результат: Знижка по вологості -* *00,00%****,*
fields.summary: В калькуляторе идет неправильный расчет при вибері базиса поставки "Філія "Сватівська" (Луганська обл.)"

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce:*
 # Open [https://school.kontur.ru/publications/347]
 # Enter 09.01.2019 and 17.01.2019 in "Период отпуска" field on "Исходные данные" tab.
 # Enter 30000 in every month field on "Сводная таблица" tab.
 # Go to "Итоги" tab.

*Expected result*: Expected amount of vacation pay is 9 215,02.

*Actual results*: Displayed amount of vacation pay is 9 215,01.
fields.summary: Incorrect calculation of amount of vacation pay.

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce:*
 # Open [http://nibulon.com/data/zakupivlya-silgospprodukcii/kalkulyator-znizhok.html]
 # Choose "Соняшник" from "Виберіть культуру" field.
 # Choose "Перевантажувальний термінал для перевалки зернових та олійних культур (м. Миколаїв)" from "Виберіть базис поставки:" field.
 # Enter 60 in "Виберіть показник вологості, %" field.
 # Enter 20 in "Виберіть показник сміттєвої домішки, %" field.
 # Press "Розрахувати" button.

*Expected result*: Discount expected in "Знижка по вологості" field is 56,52%.

*Actual results*: Discount displayed is 102,00%.

*Expected result*: calculation will be done properly.

Next 4 errors occur:

fields.description:
Since the update to 3.1.3 (not aware that was the beta), the check out are only done on the GUI, visual studio and tortoise (backup tool) don't see the change of branch.

The changes are not done on the folder, so Sourcetree is not usable at all like this for me. 

 

I tried restart windows and Sourcetree, tried to update the Git with the last version, but nothing help.
fields.summary: Branch checkout not working

fields.description:
Right after updating to 3.1.3, the app icon in the Windows menu and taskbar now looks like white document.

 

!Screenshot_752.png!

fields.description: Would you please add a theme with dark colors? Working with the text based interface with a white background is not easy. A theme with dark colors, would make the interface much easier on the eyes.

fields.description:
Шаги воспроизведения:

#открыть сайт http://nibulon.com/data/zakupivlya-silgospprodukcii/kalkulyator-znizhok.html

#Выбрать культуру "Соя"

#Выбрать базис поставки "Філія "Сватівська" (Луганська обл.)

#ввести числовые значение в форме"Виберіть показник вологості, %: 

#ввести числовые значение в форме"Виберіть показник сміттєвої домішки, %:

 

Показник вологості: 25 % ; показник сміттєвої домішки, 25%:

-Ожидаемый результат : "Знижка по вологості - 14.77 %"

-Фактический результат: "Знижка по вологості - 0%" + наличие ошибки

 

Подобная ошибка возникает при выборе таких культур  и базисов поставки: 

#Базис поставки "Філія "Сватівська" (Луганська обл.):
Пшениця, Соняшник, Соя, Сорго, Ріпак.

#Базис поставки "Філія "Вознесенська" (Миколаївська обл.)
Пшениця, Сорго.

#Базис поставки "Філія "Голоспристанська" (Херсонська обл.)
Пшениця.
fields.summary: Калькулятор скидок Nibulon, отсутсвие результатов расчета скидки, а также наличие системной ошибки (без указания причины ее возникновения) при введении любый числовых и нечисловых значений в поля для ввода выбрав определенные базисы поставки.

fields.description:
Шаги воспроизведения:

#открыть сайт http://nibulon.com/data/zakupivlya-silgospprodukcii/kalkulyator-znizhok.html

#ввести числовые значение в форме"Виберіть показник вологості, %:"  в диапазоне от   8.06 до 100.

#ввести произвольное числовые значение в форме"Виберіть показник сміттєвої домішки, %"

 

Показник вологості: 8.06 % ; показник сміттєвої домішки, 1%:

-Ожидаемый результат : "Знижка по вологості - 0,07 %"

-Фактический результат: "Знижка по вологості - 0.06 %"

 

Показник вологості: 99 % ; показник сміттєвої домішки, 1%:

-Ожидаемый результат : "Знижка по вологості - 98,91 %"

-Фактический результат: "Знижка по вологості - 180 %"

 

 http://nibulon.com/data/zakupivlya-silgospprodukcii/kalkulyator-znizhok.html

fields.description:
EDIT: This bug was discovered and confirmed with the windows version of Sourcetree. Please can a @moderator move this to the bug tracker of the windows version?

Trying to add GitLab CE, but authentication fails. The error is not really descriptive. Upon pressing the personal access token button with the following settings:

!image-2018-10-24-15-51-20-539.png!

I get this popup:

!image-2018-10-24-15-53-15-392.png!

I copy&pasted my credentials from my password DB into this multiple times. The login information is correct. However, it fails with the following message:

!image-2018-10-24-15-54-18-149.png!

 

Maybe that is because the URL contains a /gitlab after the TLD?
fields.summary: Gitlab CE authentication fails

fields.description:
When I attempt to install SourceTree 3.0.17 for Windows, I am prompted to download and install .NET Framework 4.7.1. The site I am redirected to prompts for a download of 4.7.2.

Installation of 4.7.2 does not satisfy installer requirements, and loop is repeated.
fields.summary: SourceTree complains about .NET framework 4.7.1 missing but redirects to 4.7.2

fields.description:
Since last update of Sourcetree the headers of the tabs cut the bookmark title after first space. This is quite confusing if you have more than one copy of a git repository and distinguish them by version number of the contained software.

Frequently the space is replaced by an underscore automatically. But I did not recognize any rule when this happens.

Of cause there is the workaround to use underscore. But I'd prefer to keep the spaces because of esthetic.
fields.summary: Tab headers are cut at first space
Prueba Jira

fields.description:
Please add the ability to copy files list from commit history window (see attached screenshot).

Add "Copy files list", or just make existing "Copy" item work this way.

Copy them as they displayed, i.e. with the path.

Useful to quickly get the list of changed files.
fields.summary: Ability to copy files list from commit history window

fields.description:
The tab name of a repository when I start Sourcetree is the name of the root directory (the directory that contains the .git directory).

I have several repositories that have the same directory name.

In order to ease the use of Sourcetree, I have renamed each entry of the bookmark list. The tabs have now a specific name different from the corresponding directory name.

But, when I restart Sourcetree, all the automatically opened tabs are named with the corresponding directory. The bookmarks are corrects and if I rename one, the tab is renamed as well.
fields.summary: Tab name is different from the reposirory name in the bookmarks

fields.description:
For recent SourceTree updates this fault has been "on again / off again". Right now (Version 3.1.3), using Beyond Compare as external diff tool is not working. I've tried all the usual tricks from Googling, but to no avail:
 # Drop the slashes from the arguments.
 # Select "Custom" external diff tool and manually specify path to Beyond Compare.

When using SourceTree default arguments with "BeyondCompare" selected as external diff tool, Process Viewer reports:

Unknown merge tool sourcetree
fatal: external diff died, stopping at MySourceFile.cpp
fields.summary: External diff (BeyondCompare) not working again

fields.description:
As a user I would like to navigate easily from the repository commit to the tags and their details directly and in context of the commit.

Currently I need to navigate out of context of the commit history to the tag list on the left panel and find the tag which is identical to the tag of the commit I was focused on

It could also be good to highlight/focus/sort the tags so it is easy to see tag(s) pointing to current commit.

!image-2019-05-13-15-38-37-180.png!

Currently clicking on a tag will change focus of the commit it is pointing to on the commit view. It would be great with the other way as well if more tags can point to the same commit
fields.summary: Add option for viewing (git) tag details from commit graph view

fields.description:
It is not possible to view all details of the "details" of a tag ( annotated ), if there are more information than your screen can view.

It is desired to have resizing and scroll possibilities in that view.

 !image-2019-05-13-15-22-38-042.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Git tag details view is not resizable nor scrollable

fields.description:
When adding a new repo tab, the name assigned to the repo correctly appears as the name of the tab.

When Sourcetree is closed and re-opened, the name in the tab has changed to the last part of the path name to the repo.
fields.summary: Tab names are changed after a restart

fields.description:
What happened in these months
 # Install an older version
 # Add an HTTP URL to a VSTS repo
 # Use a personal access token to authenticate
 # Add another HTTP URL to a VSTS repo
 # Use a personal access token to authenticate
 # Update SourceTree multiple times
 # Revoke the personal access tokens
 # Delete the authentications in SourceTree setting
 # Popup asking authentication as expected
 # Close the popups
 # Change the URLs to SSH (do not remember doing it in SourceTree or console)
 # Fetch the repos successfully without any popups appear
 # Popups appear asking for authentications with the old URLs

Deleting the remote repos, restarting SourceTree, adding the repos back, restarting SourceTree cannot fix the issue.
fields.summary: Periodical popup asking for login for SSH remote URL

fields.description:
It used to be possible to drag commits in the listbox to reorder them. Now, I find I can no longer drag to lines between commits to insert it–with drag-and-drop, only combining is possible.

Until recently I was able to get around that by simply dragging each commit to the space at the bottom of the listbox, inserting them in the reverse order I wanted--but with the introduction of additional bugs that is no longer possible. The dialog now resizes itself to leave no space, and although there is a draggable bar (mouse cursor changes), it is not draggable–attempting to drag it causes a visual artifact but no resizing.

Finally, on combining two commits, I now see a dialog reading "Blah" (attached).
fields.summary: Interactive Rebase: Unable to reorder; unable to resize; says "Blah"

fields.description:
I have a number of bookmarks in SourceTree for Windows.  On earlier versions (2.X), I could drag and drop them to organize them alphabetically by name in folders.  On newer versions of SourceTree for Windows (3.X), any time I attempt to drag and drop repository bookmarks within folders to organize them, the bookmark gets 'snapped' to the top-level and I'm unable to organize my repositories into folders and sort them (manually) via drag-and-drop alphabetically.  This is annoying as I have upwards of 20+ repositories to manage and access on a daily basis, and having them in alphabetical order significantly increases my productivity as I don't have to hunt for the repository that I need.

 

I've attached my computer environment (environment.txt) as well as the SourceTree log file (sourcetree.log).
fields.summary: Drag and drop of repository bookmark does not allow for organization of repository bookmarks

fields.description:
Our naming standard for feature branches is:

feature/\{developerinitials}/\{yyymmdd}_\{ticket}_description

We also use the git-flow feature in SourceTree to create and manage those branches.

Starting in 3.1.3, when we try to create that branch through git-flow, we get the error:

The name is invalid. Ref names must follow git ref-format rules: 
https://www.kernel.org/pub/software/scm/git/docs/git-check-ref-format.html
Additionally Sourcetree does not support the use of '/' in Git-flow branch names
Completed with errors, see above.

I presume you had a reason for changing this, but it was working before, and it's annoying that it has stopped working now. If we have to give up git-flow or our naming standard, we're going to give up git-flow (it's much less annoying to scroll past a dozen folders than a thousand branches), but we'd prefer not to have to give up either.

Please consider changing the behavior back to what it was before.
fields.summary: Additionally Sourcetree does not support the use of '/' in Git-flow branch names

fields.description:
# Stage file.
 # Unstage one line (blank line between lines of code).
 # Discard that line.
 # Some fatal error (runtime error??) occurs and the whole file is deleted
 # The file appear in git as removed and any other unstage lines are lost.

This happened to me for the second time. For the first time, I've lost the file after discarding multiple lines.
fields.summary: File is removed when discarding line

fields.description:
Hi Team, 

One of our users completed the Dutch translation in Transifex and was asking how to get it into Sourcetree. Seems like they can not do it from their side so we need your help. 

 

For reference, here is the Community post: [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Sourcetree-questions/Sourcetree-translation-DUTCH/qaq-p/1072907?utm_source=atlcomm&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=immediate_general_reply&utm_content=topic.|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Sourcetree-questions/Sourcetree-translation-DUTCH/qaq-p/1072907?utm_source=atlcomm&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=immediate_general_reply&utm_content=topic]

Cheers,

Ana
fields.summary: Add Dutch translation from Transifex

fields.description: When I try to organize my repository bookmarks inside a folder, they move outside the folder and not to the place I want them to move. For me to put them back in the folder I have to place them in the folder, and can't place them in a specific order in the folder. If I want a specific order I have to move the bookmarks one by one to that folder in the order I want.
fields.summary: Organizing repository bookmarks inside folders

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
 # In the settings, confirm tabs are set to reopen
 # Add a Git repository, name it differently than the folder it is located in (e.g. FooApplication for a repo in C:\assets\foo)
 # Open a tab for the repository
 # Close Sourcetree
 # Reopen Sourcetree

The tab's label shows the folder name (e.g. "foo") instead of the "repository name" (e.g. "FooApplication") given on Add or Clone.

The problem persists in the same session when closing and reopening the same repository.

Partial workaround: close the tab, close Sourcetree, reopen Sourcetree, reopen the repository. This is inconvenient as I often work with 6+ tabs simultaneously and for reasons beyond the scope of this issue many have the same folder name. (e.g. FooApplication\git, FoobarServer\git, etc.)
fields.summary: Repo names on tabs get replaced by folder on re-open
repository tab titles don't show repository name

fields.description:
The context menu only has the option to add a complete file type to git-lfs. It should be possible to add specific files, and specific folders, much like the context menu for gitignore works.

 

*Example:* In some cases, I really want to track some specific folders and files in LFS while others of the same filetype should live in regular git land. Specifically, the ".asset" extension in Unity is used for a ton of things ranging from simple, text-readable ScriptableObjects (which should live in git land) to texture arrays with a size of several hundred MB (that's for LFS then).

*2nd Example:* I might have files that are large, but need to be included in the repository. I want these (in a specific subfolder) to be in lfs storage, while files with the same extension in a different subfolder shouldn't be in lfs storage.
fields.summary: More UI options for git-lfs filters are needed

fields.description:
SourceTree Win deletes http.proxy entry in %home%\.gitconfig every time its Options dialog is closed.

Given an http.proxy entry in %home%\.gitconfig, then:
1.- Execute SourceTree Win.
2.- Exceute Tools > Options.
3.- Close Options window.

The result: the http.proxy entry in %home%\.gitconfig disappears. Any other entry (like https.proxy) is unaffected.

As a sidenote, I have a custom proxy configured in SourceTree.
fields.summary: SourceTree Win deletes http.proxy entry in %home%\.gitconfig

fields.description: For tracked/modified/unstaged files a counter is no longer appearing in File Status, but is now showing the counter in the Commit button.  But, there is nothing to commit since the files are unstaged.
fields.summary: Commit button counter changing for modified/unstaged files

fields.description:
In the latest update when I type a commit message every character lags noticeably. This is always reproducable and never happened before the latest update.

Steps to repro:
 * Open Source Tree
 * Add a few files to staging
 * Press File Status/Commit
 * Type in the commit message and notice lag
fields.summary: Typing in a commit message is slow in 3.1.3
